translation.en: There's an entire world to discover.

translation.en: [Brian] I was working in London for five years as a jobbing illustrator,
translation.ja: ロンドンで５年間 イラストを描いてた

translation.en: and I needed to do my own work, but I didn't know exactly what that was.
translation.ja: 自分の作品を作るにも 何をしたいか分からなかった

translation.en: But once I got the opportunity to move to the country here,
translation.ja: ここに 引っ越す機会があった デザイナー ブライアン･フロウド

translation.en: then, immediately, the first thing I painted
translation.ja: そしてすぐに描いたのが―

translation.en: was, indeed, this picture of a troll with trees behind it
translation.ja: 木を背景にした トロールだった

translation.en: and a waterfall coming off its nose.
translation.ja: 先端が滝になってる

translation.en: And that's what Jim saw.
translation.ja: それをジムが見た

translation.en: And I was a bit overcome, I think, meeting Jim,
translation.ja: ジムに会って圧倒された

translation.en: and I didn't know quite what to say or how to express myself,
translation.ja: 何というのか うまく言えないけど

translation.en: and it was his leap of faith.
translation.ja: 理屈抜きに 信じてくれていた

translation.en: [Cheryl] My father really wanted to do an epic fantasy adventure.
translation.ja: 父は壮大なファンタジーを 創りたがってた

translation.en: He really enjoyed doing comedy.
translation.ja: 「セサミストリート」も 父は楽しんでた ジム･ヘンソン財団 シェリル･ヘンソン

translation.en: He enjoyed doing Muppets. He loved Sesame Street.
translation.ja: 「セサミストリート」も 父は楽しんでた ジム･ヘンソン財団 シェリル･ヘンソン 「セサミストリート」も 父は楽しんでた

translation.en: He loved the sort of fast, funny, vignette kind of variety show,
translation.ja: 展開が速くて面白い バラエティが好きだったわ

translation.en: but he wanted to do something that really told a complex narrative.
translation.ja: でも もっと複雑な物語を 創りたがっていた

translation.en: [Brian] But quite quickly, we were hiring people that had other skills,
translation.ja: すぐに違う技能を持つ人を 雇い始めた

translation.en: and Wendy was brought on board specifically for the Gelflings,
translation.ja: ゲルフリンには ウェンディが選ばれた

translation.en: because Jim wanted that strong feminine thing.
translation.ja: ジムが女性らしさを 求めたんだ

translation.en: It was all about bringing a character to life, all about creating something you've never seen before
translation.ja: 見たことのない物を作り 命を吹き込む

translation.en: that he was hoping the audience would not only believe in,
translation.ja: そして観客に 信じてもらうだけでなく

translation.en: but also scratch their heads and go, "How do you do that?"
translation.ja: 〝どうやってる？〞と 考えさせる

translation.en: Hang on!
translation.ja: 待って！

translation.en: [Stephen] You have Brian Froud, who is a guy who, for this world, these things are real.
translation.ja: ブライアン･フロウドは この世界が本物だと信じてる

translation.en: You have Frank Oz, who is one of the most brilliant puppeteers who's ever lived,
translation.ja: フランク･オズは 卓越した技能を持つ人形師だ

translation.en: and you have Jim bringing the world-building, and the humanity,
translation.ja: ジムはその世界を作り出し―

translation.en: and the sense of human nature being put into these puppets.
translation.ja: 人形に人間性を吹き込む

translation.en: It's a brilliant kind of creative melting pot that brought the original thing to life.
translation.ja: 優れた創造力のるつぼが オリジナル映画を実現した

translation.en: [Taron] We live in an age of sequels and prequels,
translation.ja: 外伝や続編はよくある

translation.en: but the great thing about The Dark Crystal is
translation.ja: ｢ダーククリスタル｣は 世界の縮図だ

translation.ja: ｢ダーククリスタル｣は 世界の縮図だ 観終えると―

translation.en: you're left with these massive questions
translation.ja: “宇宙とは何か？”という 疑問が残る

translation.en: about the universe at large which have never been answered.
translation.ja: “宇宙とは何か？”という 疑問が残る 答えがない

translation.en: [Cheryl] There are people who obsess about Dark Crystal, who really care about Dark Crystal,
translation.ja: ｢ダーククリスタル｣に 人が魅了され―

translation.en: and over the years, it's really become a cult film.
translation.ja: 時が経つと カルト映画になったの

translation.en: [Stephen] Is there going to be a feature film sequel?
translation.ja: フィーチャー映画の続編は？

translation.en: Is there gonna be an animated TV show?
translation.ja: アニメ番組になる？

translation.en: I don't think that you could have done

translation.en: with the right budget, with the creative team that Henson assembled.
translation.ja: Netflixを使い 予算があり チームを編成できたおかげだ

translation.en: I mean, it's so exciting to see the world come back to life in that way.
translation.ja: こんな形で世界が復活し ワクワクした

translation.en: All too often, projects are rebooted or remade based on an IP
translation.ja: 知的財産が理由で 計画がよく頓挫する 知的財産が理由で 計画がよく頓挫する ネットフリックス ディレクター テッド･ビアセリ

translation.en: where all the DNA of that thing that makes people love it is discarded.
translation.ja: ネットフリックス ディレクター テッド･ビアセリ 人が好きな作品の ＤＮＡが抜かれてしまう 人が好きな作品の ＤＮＡが抜かれてしまう

translation.en: But, for me, if you're going to remake or reboot a franchise,
translation.ja: でも僕に言わせれば リメイクするなら―

translation.en: go back to why people like it in the first place.
translation.ja: そのＤＮＡを出すべきだ

translation.en: [Cindy] Teddy Biaselli had told me that Henson were interested in doing an animated series of The Dark Crystal,

translation.en: and I thought about it, and I went home and I watched the movie again.
translation.ja: 家に帰って映画を見て 考えてみた

translation.en: I kept thinking about it. I was, like, "Well the mythology is great,
translation.ja: すばらしい神話ではある

translation.en: but what makes it really special and transcendent is the puppets."
translation.ja: でも 抜群に目を引くのは 人形だった

translation.en: [Ted] I picked up the phone. I was, like, "Okay, good news, bad news.
translation.ja: 電話で こう伝えた

translation.ja: 〝残念だが アニメ版は作れない〞

translation.en: The good news is Cindy wants to know what it would cost to do it live-action."
translation.ja: 〝でも実写映画なら いくらかかる？〞

translation.en: And you could hear the phone hit the floor.
translation.ja: 電話が床に 落ちた音が聞こえた

translation.en: And we were shocked.
translation.ja: たまげたわ

translation.en: [laughs] Like, "Really? A series that looks like the film?"
translation.ja: 〝人形劇シリーズ？〞

translation.en: [Cindy] The best version of The Dark Crystal that could be made today,
translation.ja: 過去最高の 「ダーククリスタル」は―

translation.en: would be made by the Henson Company,

translation.en: by giving them the freedom

translation.en: to really reach for the best version they can possibly imagine.
translation.ja: 最高の可能性を 引き出すことができる

translation.en: -[gasps] -[laughs] Gelfling!

translation.en: So what we had tried to do in the test
translation.ja: テストで撮影したのは―

translation.en: was we did CG Gelfling with puppet Skeksis.
translation.ja: ＣＧのゲルフリンと 人形のスケクシス

translation.en: Trespasser!
translation.ja: 不法侵入だ！

translation.en: [Andy] Does it make sense to do a TV show in the same way that they did the original film?
translation.ja: オリジナル映画と同じ方法で 作るべきか？

translation.en: You know, how much has, of-- has technology progressed?
translation.ja: 技術は進化してるのに？ 技術は進化してるのに？ ＣＧ監修 アンディ･ ハーグリーブス 技術は進化してるのに？

translation.en: [Skeksis] What's that smell?
translation.ja: 何の臭いだ？

translation.en: There's something disparate
translation.ja: 全く違うんだ

translation.ja: 物体に光が当たった時の 重なり方や質感は―

translation.ja: コンピュータ生成とは 違う

translation.ja: どれだけよく出来ても 違いが顕著に見える

translation.en: [Lisa] We could make a clean marriage between the two. And, technically, it could be done,
translation.ja: 二つをきれいに融合できる 技術はあるけど

translation.en: but the CG Gelfling didn't look like Gelflings.
translation.ja: ＣＧでは ゲルフリンらしくない

translation.en: [Ritamarie] No matter what you did with the eyes of the puppet,
translation.ja: 人形の目に何をしても―

translation.en: those puppet glass eyes were so hard to replicate
translation.ja: 人形のガラスの目を 再現するのが難しい 人形のガラスの目を 再現するのが難しい プロデューサー リタ･ペルギ 人形のガラスの目を 再現するのが難しい

translation.en: in a CG environment, that you immediately could see
translation.ja: ＣＧ環境では ＣＧと人形の差が―

translation.en: that it was CG talking to the puppet,
translation.ja: すぐに分かってしまう

translation.en: then you really just wanted to see the puppet.
translation.ja: 人形を見たいのに

translation.ja: ＣＧと人形で撮影開始前に テストを見たところ―

translation.en: it was... I mean, it's like night and day.
translation.ja: 全く違っていた

translation.en: It's amazing how much more evocative the... the puppet is.
translation.ja: 撮影監督 エリック･ウィルソン 人形の方が想像力を 刺激する

translation.en: [Alice] As masterful as it is, you can't talk to a Pixar character in the real world.
translation.ja: ピクサーの登場人物と 現実では話せない

translation.en: but I think you know that you could.

translation.ja: 楽しいだけではなく

translation.ja: どれだけ効果を出せるか 人形師 ルイーズ･ゴールド

translation.ja: するとＣＧ会社が 見せたいものがあると

translation.en: and be doing what has got to be the biggest puppet production ever.

translation.en: This has no humans, so it is a complete puppet extravaganza.

translation.ja: ＣＧには心を奪われる

translation.en: but there is so much of it
translation.ja: でもありすぎると―

translation.en: that I think there is an element of kind of desensitizing that happens.
translation.ja: 鈍感になってしまう 要素がある

translation.en: The wonderful thing about this world is everything has weight,
translation.ja: この世界では すべてに重みがある

translation.en: it's real, it has texture.
translation.ja: 本物の質感がある

translation.en: If you were in front of the camera, you could reach out and grab them,
translation.ja: カメラの前にいて― 手を伸ばせば届くという 現実性も面白いと思う

translation.en: and I think that's really exciting, too. The reality of it, the weight of it.
translation.ja: 手を伸ばせば届くという 現実性も面白いと思う

translation.en: [Peter] Jim would have embraced every tool in the box available to him.
translation.ja: ジムは使えるものは 何でも使う

translation.en: And I have no doubt that he would have absolutely loved CG and what CG would have allowed him to do.
translation.ja: 彼は間違いなく ＣＧを気に入っただろう

translation.en: [Cheryl] My father was a real innovator
translation.ja: 父は革新者だった

translation.en: when it comes to all different kinds of aspects of puppets on television, puppets on film.
translation.ja: 多種多様な人形を テレビや映画に使ってた

translation.en: And he had to invent all the time. He had to come up with new ways of doing things.
translation.ja: 新しいやり方を 毎回発明する必要があったの

translation.en: Oh, hi family.
translation.ja: ただいま

translation.en: -Hello, Nurlocks, feeding time. -[Peter] We didn't want to just rely on the fact that CG could potentially fix the problem
translation.ja: ＣＧで問題を直せると 依存したくなかった

translation.en: or could even substitute a digital character for a... for a practical character.
translation.ja: 本物をデジタルで 代用したくない

translation.en: We wanted to make sure that everything that we did and all the shots could be covered practically.
translation.ja: だからできる限り 実物でカバーするようにした

translation.en: We've been talking for a long time about using more puppeteer removal,
translation.ja: 人形師を外に出し― 大きなキャラクターを 外から操ろうと話してた

translation.en: so that you can do a large character by controlling from the outside,
translation.ja: 大きなキャラクターを 外から操ろうと話してた

translation.en: and then removing the puppeteers and the rods.
translation.ja: 中から 棒や人形師を省けるの

translation.en: [Damian] The guys in DNeg are doing some interesting tests for some of the CG shots that they have to do,
translation.ja: ダブル･ネガティブ社が 面白いＣＧを試してる

translation.en: where they've built a human figure behind the CG rig.
translation.ja: 人間の形を ＣＧの後ろに置き 人間の形を ＣＧの後ろに置き 人形師 ダミアン･ファレル

translation.en: And it'll be articulated from the human figure behind it.
translation.ja: 人形師 ダミアン･ファレル 人形師 ダミアン･ファレル 後ろの人が操作する

translation.en: So, it kind of mimics all the... the kind of, uh... kind of the inaccuracies and all that, so it doesn't become too smooth.
translation.ja: それで不的確さを模倣し スムーズになりすぎない

translation.en: You can get motion capture directly onto that.
translation.ja: ダブル･ネガティブ社 スタフォード･ ローレンス モーションキャプチャを 直に出来る

translation.en: So, then, you're literally replicating the performance through the puppeteer.
translation.ja: こうやって人形師の演技を 再現する

translation.en: Anything that gets us as close as possible to the methods that the puppeteers are using.
translation.ja: すべて人形師が使う方法に 極力近づけてある

translation.en: Lore is a character that was originally decided to be a full CG character
translation.ja: ロアは当初はＣＧキャラの 予定だった

translation.en: because of the way he's articulated, what he's made of, and the things he has to do in the script.
translation.ja: 動きや作りを 脚本通りにするために

translation.en: [Ted] We had so many meetings about the look of Lore.
translation.ja: ロアの外観は 何度も話し合った

translation.en: I mean, this thing evolved.
translation.ja: これは進化したんだ

translation.en: At one point, he had, you know, three legs.
translation.ja: ３本足の時から

translation.en: At one point, he looked like a giant turtle.
translation.ja: 亀の外観まで

translation.en: At one point he-- you know, he was just a big block.
translation.ja: ブロックの時もあった

translation.en: I mean, there were so many looks of Lore,
translation.ja: 何通りも見た上で これにたどり着いた

translation.en: and now we've come to this thing where it looks like a pile of stone,
translation.ja: 何通りも見た上で これにたどり着いた 岩の塊で崩れそうに見える

translation.en: and it looked like they were gonna fall.
translation.ja: 岩の塊で崩れそうに見える

translation.en: And he says, "I think there's a Lore in this."
translation.ja: これがロアだと言った

translation.en: [Andy] The more we started to work on it, the more people got thinking about him.
translation.ja: 考え始めると 色んな案が出てきて―

translation.en: We did animation tests, and that got the puppeteers excited,
translation.ja: テストした 人形師も興奮した

translation.en: and then it became this thing where they were like,
translation.ja: 最終的には―

translation.en: "Well, you know, we can build a puppet that can do way more than we thought
translation.ja: 想像以上の 人形を作ることが出来た

translation.en: and gives Louis even more on set and on camera."
translation.ja: ルイも専念した

translation.en: [Jeff] We thought we had set this challenge you couldn't do, and then they did it.
translation.ja: 出来ない課題を 見事に成し遂げた

translation.en: And so, Lore is on set, and Lore is there, and Lore is puppeteered,
translation.ja: ロアをセットにのせて そこで操る

translation.en: and it's beautiful to see them interact and come together.
translation.ja: その出来栄えは すばらしかった

translation.en: Well, Lore's got this really nice, uh, you know, sort of, like, layers of rock,
translation.ja: ロアにはこの… 岩の重なりがある ロアにはこの… 岩の重なりがある 人形師 フィル･イーソン 人形師 フィル･イーソン

translation.en: and mostly when Damon moves the head,
translation.ja: 人形師 フィル･イーソン 頭を動かすときは してる事や―

translation.en: just trying to keep it sympathetic with what he's doing
translation.ja: 人形師 フィル･イーソン 頭を動かすときは してる事や― 人形師 フィル･イーソン 人形師 フィル･イーソン 見てることに 共感するようにする 見てることに 共感するようにする

translation.en: and what he's observing,
translation.ja: 見てることに 共感するようにする

translation.en: because it looks like a mouth,
translation.ja: 口に見えるけど

translation.en: but this is really where he's seeing through, isn't it?
translation.ja: ここから見てるからね

translation.en: He can be down quite low, and then he can be up quite high.
translation.ja: 低くも 高くもなり得る

translation.en: So, we know that they're kind of key positions that he will always go to, you know?
translation.ja: だから重要な位置に いつも行くんだ

translation.en: [Ted] Never in my dreams would I think that that thing would be so cool,
translation.ja: 夢にも思わなかったけど

translation.en: but, man, I can't wait to own a Lore figure. [laughs]
translation.ja: あのロアは欲しい

translation.en: [Simon] It's nice to see the CG technology used collaboratively with the puppets,
translation.ja: ＣＧ技術と人形の連携を 見れてうれしい

translation.en: so the whole thing feels very true to The Dark Crystal.
translation.ja: 全てがオリジナルに忠実で

translation.en: It is, first and foremost, a puppet-led thing,
translation.ja: 何よりも人形が中心だ

translation.en: but there are tiny little things you can do.
translation.ja: でも出来る事がある

translation.en: Like, in the original film, not that it mattered,
translation.ja: オリジナルでは―

translation.en: and not that I cared, and not that it was ever a thing, but, occasionally, you can see a rod now and again, you know?
translation.ja: 重要ではないけれど 時々 棒が見えてた

translation.en: Not that that means, "Wait, there's a rod, it's not real."
translation.ja: それを 責めるつもりはない

translation.en: You know it's not real, it's a puppet show. You should be able to see all the rods really.
translation.ja: 人形劇では 棒が見えて当然だ

translation.en: But what they can do now is they can remove that stuff,
translation.ja: でも今では取り除ける

translation.en: add blinks, add little bits and bobs,
translation.ja: そしてまばたきで―

translation.en: which give them a little bit more life and presence,
translation.ja: もっと生き生きと させられる

translation.en: and... and just help with the magic trick that it is.
translation.ja: 手品のようにね

translation.en: The way it's developed, even the effects that are CG effects,
translation.ja: ＣＧ効果だったものでも

translation.en: we've now complemented most of those by realizing them in a dual capacity
translation.ja: 今では大部分が 両方で出来る

translation.en: where we have the puppet version of it and the CG version of it.
translation.ja: 人形版とＣＧ版があり

translation.en: So there's almost nothing in the whole series that exists only as a CG effect.
translation.ja: どこをとっても ＣＧ単独の効果はない

translation.en: [Andy] It's still photo real. In some ways, the techniques are still the same.
translation.ja: 静止画だから技法は同じだ

translation.en: We're still replicating the real world, it's just that the real world is Thra.
translation.ja: 複製する世界がトラなだけだ

translation.en: It's Jim Henson's, it's Brian Froud's.
translation.ja: ジムやブライアンの世界

translation.en: And I think there's something about the... the tangible,
translation.ja: 目に見える 手作りの質があるために

translation.en: hand-crafted quality of it all that immediately makes people think,
translation.ja: 目に見える 手作りの質があるために 未経験の事だから―

translation.en: "Well actually, this isn't like anything we've done before,
translation.ja: 未経験の事だから― 違う考え方が必要だと すぐ分かる

translation.en: so we do need to think differently about it."
translation.ja: 違う考え方が必要だと すぐ分かる

translation.en: The plan now is for the CG to be more based on the rigging
translation.ja: 今の計画ではＣＧは 特機の部分に―

translation.en: and have all these little flaws in it
translation.ja: 細かい欠点を入れる

translation.en: that the... um, that puppets have.
translation.ja: それで人形のようにする

translation.en: [Andy] For me, it should always be, you know,
translation.ja: 僕に言わせれば―

translation.en: it's not just for the art department to try and work this out, 'cause maybe the VFX guys can do it better.
translation.ja: 美術だけではダメでも 視覚効果が補助できる

translation.en: It's not just for the VFX guys to do it, 'cause, actually, if you built it, it'd be better.
translation.ja: 視覚効果のみでなく 作った方が良い時もある

translation.en: You know, no one should be too precious about what they're doing.
translation.ja: 一方だけというのはない

translation.en: The great thing about voice work is that it's inherently a collaborative process,
translation.ja: 声の仕事の良い所は 協業プロセスという点だ

translation.en: and you are far from the most important cog in the machine.
translation.ja: 重要な役割を担う

translation.en: They have made choices in movement, in pace, in style.
translation.ja: 動きもペースも様式も 人形師が決める

translation.en: They've made characterization choices that you inherit.
translation.ja: 人形師の役作りを 継承するの

translation.en: [Simon] It a very interesting process, and it's been very, very challenging in a good way,
translation.ja: 面白いプロセスで 良い意味で難しい

translation.en: because usually when you do a voice in something,
translation.ja: 普通 声優をする時は―

translation.en: if you do animation, you do the voice, and then the animators take your voice and they animate to the voice.
translation.ja: アニメーションなら 録音した声を編集する

translation.en: With this, it's the other way around.
translation.ja: これは真逆だ

translation.en: You have to match your performance to the puppeteers,
translation.ja: 声の演技を 人形師に合わせる

translation.en: who are all very good at what they do.
translation.ja: 彼らが達人だから

translation.en: They are actors, you know, they characterize, but you have to match their mouth flaps.
translation.ja: 彼らが作った役の 口の動きに合わせる

translation.en: [Jason] It's an interesting discipline, because the puppeteers,
translation.ja: 面白い分野だ 人形師たちは―

translation.en: the world's greatest puppeteers,
translation.ja: 世界屈指の人たちだ

translation.en: have done the work already
translation.ja: 彼らがした演技が―

translation.en: and so, you have to act and convey truth, power, fear, threat, whatever it is,
translation.ja: 真実や力や 恐怖や威嚇を伝えている

translation.en: but you have to match the discipline.
translation.ja: 合わせるんだ

translation.en: The Crystal calls.
translation.ja: クリスタルの叫びだ

translation.en: To the crystal chamber!
translation.ja: クリスタルの部屋へ

translation.en: Ah, scroll keeper. Scroll keeper!
translation.ja: ああ　記録官よ！

translation.en: [Jason] You take a lot of time to get it right,
translation.ja: 何度もやる

translation.en: because you can be satisfied that you matched the movement in sync,
translation.ja: 動きに同期していても

translation.en: but you're trying to give performances that are as real and as engaging as possible.
translation.ja: 自分の演技が 本物でなければならない

translation.en: Go? Leave?
translation.ja: 行け？　帰れと？

translation.en: No, no, no.
translation.ja: ダメダメ

translation.ja: グルーナックの仕事の完了は 侍従長が決める

translation.en: Until then, Grunac stay right where are.
translation.ja: それまでグルーナックは 今のままだ

translation.en: So, that's actually quite hard sometimes,
translation.ja: 非常に難しい時もある

translation.en: when you might choose a different way of delivering a line,
translation.ja: セリフの言い方も―

translation.en: but you've got to get it into this rhythm of, uh... of speech.
translation.ja: このリズムにしなければ ならない

translation.en: It is amazing to be part of that group of... of Skeksis.
translation.ja: スケクシスになれて すばらしい

translation.en: Much to do. Much fun to be had.
translation.ja: することが沢山ある 楽しもう

translation.en: From there?
translation.ja: そこから？

translation.en: So... she hits him.
translation.ja: 彼を叩いて

translation.en: So, first, like...
translation.ja: まず…

translation.en: She told you to let go!
translation.ja: 放してと言ったわ

translation.en: She told you to let go.
translation.ja: 放してと言ったわ

translation.en: Okay?
translation.ja: いい？

translation.en: And there's something hard about it.
translation.ja: 難しい局面もある

translation.en: It's really difficult, but the reward is even greater
translation.ja: 難しいけど 達成感が大きいの

translation.en: because it's tangible, it feels tactile.
translation.ja: 目に見えて 触れる事が出来るから

translation.en: It's also key that you create a sense of spontaneity in it,
translation.ja: 自発的に出来る事が 重要だ

translation.en: an immediacy, and... and life.
translation.ja: そうすれば命が入る

translation.en: We protect the Lords,
translation.ja: 我々が支配者を守り

translation.en: the Lords protect the Crystal of Truth.
translation.ja: 支配者がクリスタルを守る

translation.en: [Natalie] The ensemble cast of actors that are doing the voice work speaks for itself.
translation.ja: 声優の顔ぶれだけでも すごいわ

translation.en: It's incredible. But behind that is the other layers of the puppeteers,
translation.ja: でも後ろに何層もある 人形師や衣装など―

translation.en: and the suit artists,
translation.ja: 人形師や衣装など―

translation.en: and, um, it's a team eff-- like, it's genuinely a team effort.
translation.ja: 本当にチームで 協力してるの

translation.en: It's a huge variety of people, uh, in this,
translation.ja: 色んな人がいる

translation.en: from different countries, and cultures, and I think you'll get a sense of that.
translation.ja: 国も文化も違うし― 折衷的な世界を 感じてもらえる

translation.en: You'll get a sense of a big, eclectic world.
translation.ja: 折衷的な世界を 感じてもらえる

translation.en: So, this is when we see the crystal.
translation.ja: これがクリスタル これがクリスタル 作曲家 ダニエル･ペンバートン 作曲家 ダニエル･ペンバートン

translation.en: So when the crystal comes down, we get this sound
translation.ja: 作曲家 ダニエル･ペンバートン 降りてくる時に

translation.en: that we've come to associate with the crystal.
translation.ja: これがクリスタルの音

translation.en: And there's an instability to sound.
translation.ja: 不安定な音で―

translation.en: This is kind of connected to the crystal and the, uh, Skeksis.
translation.ja: クリスタルとスケクシスに 関係している

translation.en: In a way, it's a very uncomfortable sound.
translation.ja: とても不穏な音だ

translation.en: So this creates, again...
translation.ja: これで…

translation.en: a sound you wouldn't associate with an orchestra.
translation.ja: この音は オーケストラらしくない

translation.en: It's just a very unusual sound.
translation.ja: 変わってる音だ

translation.en: [Daniel] The Dark Crystal world always felt, to me, like from a different time.
translation.ja: 「ダーククリスタル」は 別の時代だから

translation.en: I sort of felt, musically, I wanted to incorporate as many different elements
translation.ja: 音楽にも違う要素を 入れたかった

translation.en: from all types of musical culture into the score.
translation.ja: 多種多様な音楽文化を入れた

translation.en: I also wanted to give it a simplicity in way,
translation.ja: それに単純さも入れた

translation.en: because a lot of early instruments, they often-- they might not even have a chromatic scale,
translation.ja: 初期の楽器では 半音階が出せず―

translation.en: they might have quite a simple scale on them.
translation.ja: 単純な音階だけだ

translation.en: And by limiting yourself to more of just a smaller range of notes,
translation.ja: だから限られた音しか 使わないことで―

translation.en: it starts to feel, hopefully, more authentic.
translation.ja: 元に忠実に感じる

translation.en: I want it to feel like this music could have been made in Thra.
translation.ja: トラで作った 音楽のようにしたい

translation.en: Cast him out.
translation.ja: 追い出せ！

translation.en: How can they not?
translation.ja: そうだろう？

translation.en: To believe him is not to believe themselves.
translation.ja: 彼を信じると 自分達を疑うことになる

translation.en: [Daniel] And so, the idea with that is we can use it in lots of different ways through the show.
translation.ja: それを番組の中の 色んな箇所で使える

translation.en: [Skeksis] Thra belongs to us now.
translation.ja: 今ではわしらのものだ

translation.en: And is nothing... nothing Gelfling can do!
translation.ja: ゲルフリンに出来ることは 何一つない

translation.en: The first time we were going round set, we would just find all these,
translation.ja: セットを見た時― すごい物だらけだった

translation.en: like, mad objects,
translation.ja: すごい物だらけだった

translation.en: and we were like, "Oh, wow!" You could just... It was so tactile.
translation.ja: 触ることが出来るんだ

translation.en: And I think that's a really important word in this.
translation.ja: 重要な事だと思う

translation.en: If the music can feel as tactile as everything else, then we've sort of succeeded.
translation.ja: 肌で感じる事が出来る 音楽なら成功だ

translation.en: [Daniel] I think everyone involved in this show
translation.ja: 参加者は全員―

translation.en: has put so much work and effort
translation.ja: すごい努力を注ぎ込んでる

translation.en: into every minute detail.
translation.ja: 細部に至るまでだ

translation.en: I think every department,
translation.ja: 全ての部門で

translation.en: from, you know, sound, to costume design,
translation.ja: 音響から衣装デザイン

translation.en: to story, to set building, the puppeteers,
translation.ja: 脚本も大道具も人形師も

translation.en: everyone is putting something
translation.ja: 全員の努力が―

translation.en: that most of us wouldn't even know what-- what is going into it.
translation.ja: 裏に隠れている

translation.en: And that's what makes the show so special, I think, because...
translation.ja: だから特別だと思う 他に全く類を見ない 独創的なものだから

translation.en: it's creatively like... unlike anything else you've seen.
translation.ja: 他に全く類を見ない 独創的なものだから

translation.en: [Jason] Nobody's making films with puppets anymore,
translation.ja: 人形劇映画はもうない

translation.en: the world's greatest puppeteers. They're working at the very top of their game.
translation.ja: でも 一流人形師は 最高の仕事をした

translation.en: They're working in a context where one of the greatest DPs in the world is lighting it and shooting it.
translation.ja: 一流の撮影監督が 彼らの演技を撮影する

translation.en: And so, uh, it's a look that you've never seen before.
translation.ja: 見たことのない光景だった

translation.en: It's a look I've never seen before, that's for sure.
translation.ja: 少なくとも僕には

translation.en: Go where I can see you. I'll be on the other side.
translation.ja: 見える所に行けば立つよ

translation.en: [Taron] Film-making of all types is deceptively simple.
translation.ja: 映画製作は簡単に見える

translation.en: That's the thing about it, you know, it's an illusion
translation.ja: でもそれは錯覚だ

translation.en: and that's the great joy of it, you know,
translation.ja: 沢山の人達が 労を惜しまず―

translation.en: that there's a bunch of people who are working painstakingly and lovingly
translation.ja: 沢山の人達が 労を惜しまず― 時間をかけて 一緒に作り上げる

translation.en: to create something that other people enjoy
translation.ja: 時間をかけて 一緒に作り上げる それを人が観るのは ほんの一瞬だ

translation.en: in a fraction of the time it took to create.
translation.ja: それを人が観るのは ほんの一瞬だ

translation.en: Louis was just fantastic. I mean he... [laughs]
translation.ja: ルイは素晴らしかった

translation.en: I don't know how he does it. He almost immediately got how a movie like this is made.
translation.ja: どう撮るべきか 瞬時に理解していた

translation.en: I really love the fact that he embraced our methodology so wholeheartedly.
translation.ja: 僕らの手法を完全に取り込み うれしかった

translation.en: I felt he was always, you know, behind us. He was championing what we were doing.
